column4: My problem is: whenever my preseed-install reaches the tasksel-step, it fails: tasksel tasksel/first multiselect standard, ubuntu-desktop
And I get a screen saying the failing step is "Select and install software"
anyone have any ideas? What my own googling returned as suspect is partitioning, but I need the preseed file to automatically partition the disk (just use whole disk, wipe anything else on there)
you want to setup auto install?
seems I saw some other people  having problems with preeseed,  I thought I saw another method other than preseed that debian used
ubuntu is indeed supposed to support kickstart, but I tried that and couldn't get ubuntu to obey the kickstart-file
oh ya it was kickstart that's mest up not preseed
and I saw a method to create the preseed file with the alternate ubuntu iso installer
that's the same ubuntu sever iso I think that the same as the alternate
where are you putting you preseed.cfg file and how are you passing the file to the installer?
I just run pxe from one of my servers
ok and how do you tell it where that files is at boot?
ok thanks I'm reading the cobbler docs to see if I should install it or just make the needed changes in my pxe server to try it
in my pxe boot it just comes up like a live cd and it's all manual to install, so I'm going to try this preseed method to install to a virtualbox presents
I've already use dhcp3 and will make the needed changes there
yes there is another added option at boot install for text but I thought that was the default in the alternate installer
I don't think I provided any help yet, but your welcome any way
